description: Maxed out the supporting tracks' volume (Brightness 1, Saw Synth 1 and 2)
title: Time To Make History (Persona 4 Golden)

description: Removed unused tracks and brought the supporting tracks' volume up. There is definitely a rock organ part, empty track for now.
title: Time To Make History (Persona 4 Golden)

description:
I think there may be a limit to how quiet Songsterr's distortion guitars can go, as the previous change wasn't very noticeable even though it was another 25% drop in volume. Switched it to an overdrive guitar to keep most of the sound but hopefully make it quieter.

Also, felt that some of the tremolo on this track wasn't quite there, so they have been replaced by just standard quarter notes. Plus, I removed the parts on m. 16-17, as the guitar part comes in on the prechorus at m. 18, not the start at m. 16.
title: Time To Make History (Persona 4 Golden)

description: Still a little too loud. Dropping the distortion guitar as low as it can go. When I max my earbud volume and Solo the track, it sounds like just barely audible static, with the pitches also somehow still intact. May need to bring it up a bit depending on if this works or not.
title: Time To Make History (Persona 4 Golden)

description: A little tinny, for lack of a better word, but it sounds better. It can go lower, though; the more I listen, the more I can't really tell where the distortion guitar is, as it really just sounds like all bass. Bass is already cranked up to max though, so I've just brought down the same distortion guitar more.
title: Time To Make History (Persona 4 Golden)

description: Quieted the distortion guitar a lot, it drowned out everything else whenever it played. Turns out I don't have to manually adjust every note's dynamic in the sheet music, but rather turn the Volume knob for the instrument in the Properties menu in Tuxguitar. Will see if this is an acceptable volume on Songsterr.
title: Time To Make History (Persona 4 Golden)

description:
Slowed tempo down from 100 to 95; slight change but it makes a world of difference when comparing with the official audio.

Even if it sounded cooler, the drum tab was entirely wrong. I have rewritten every single measure with the appropriate notes, lengths, accents and details (see the text above certain measures). 

There's a MuseScore tab (made a year before this Songsterr tab) with a drum part that looks identical to this, so I have to assume it was copied entirely from that old tab. I'm all for reducing work, but not using your own ears to confirm accuracy is how these incorrect tabs spread everywhere and confuse players.
title: Time To Make History (Persona 4 Golden)
